data.title: Minister kicks off Space Week 2024
data.description: The Thai government’s determination to spur investment in satellite development and space infrastructure was highlighted at the opening of  Thailand Space Week  2024 on Thursday.

data.title: Thaksin ‘yet to testify’ in hospital stay case
data.description: Ex-premier  Thaksin Shinawatra  has yet to testify in a case in which he and the ruling Pheu Thai Party are accused of attempting to undermine the constitutional monarchy, as the deadline for public prosecutors to submit a report on the case to the Constitutional Court approaches.

data.title: Agencies take aim at mule accounts
data.description: The Department of Business Development (DBD) at the Ministry of Commerce is teaming up with the police Central Investigation Bureau (CIB) to combat corporate  mule accounts  and  nominee  operations.

data.title: Thai PM meets Myanmar junta chief
data.description: Thai Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra met Myanmar’s junta chief on the sidelines of a regional summit in China on Thursday, in a rare overseas trip by a general grappling with a civil war at home.

data.title: House, Senate hope to meet halfway on referendum
data.description: A compromise could be on the horizon between the House of Representatives and the Senate on the criteria for a  referendum  on amending the  constitution .

data.title: Maris lays out Thailand’s priorities in world ‘becoming increasingly divided’
data.description: Foreign minister sees no threat to Thai-US relations after the election of Trump

data.title: Three tough challenges the ruling Pheu Thai Party faces
data.description: The MoU with Cambodia and the NACC probe into alleged privileged treatment for Thaksin are hot-button issues

data.title: Biden set to make first post-election comments
data.description: WASHINGTON - US President Joe Biden was set to address the nation on Thursday after a stinging election defeat for his Democratic Party at the hands of Republican Donald Trump, whose stunning political comeback has reverberated around the world.

data.title: Nation TV anchor files defamation lawsuit against lawyer Sittha
data.description: The lawsuit accuses Sittha Biabungkerd of falsely claiming a certain politician had paid the anchor to cover news of his 71-million baht embezzlement case

data.title: CSD seeks to deny bail for lawyer, wife in 71m baht embezzlement case
data.description: Famous lawyer Sittha Biabungkerd and his wife were arrested while allegedly fleeing to escape charges of fraud and money laundering

data.title: Anatoly Malykhin, Reug Reug pulled apart in ONE 169 press conference brawl
data.description: Anatoly Malykhin and Omar “Reug Reug” Kane almost came to blows twice on a frantic day as their ONE Championship heavyweight MMA title fight threatened to boil over in Bangkok.

data.title: Maid sentenced to 235 years for serial gold thefts
data.description: KHON KAEN - A maid has been sentenced to 235 years in jail for dozens of thefts of gold ornaments worth about 25 million baht from her employer’s shop.

data.title: Chinese EV-makers offer discounts to boost their year-end sales
data.description: Chinese electric vehicle (EV) manufacturers are offering new models and up to 100,000 baht discounts in a bid to stimulate sales in the remainder of this year, according to a Thansettakij report on Thursday.

data.title: Special Presentation: Rediscovering extraordinary classics
data.description: The “Special Presentation” category of the 16th World Film Festival of Bangkok, which launches today, features timeless classics that have been restored for a glorious return to the big screen.

data.title: Lawyer testifies before panel over claims against Pheu Thai, Thaksin
data.description: OAG summons all three parties to testify after charter court asks why it has not responded to the lawyer’s many complaints

data.title: Financial Literacy 101: Understanding and Applying Sustainable Investment
data.description: Financial literacy is needed now more than ever to navigate with any confidence a fast-moving world where obstacles and pitfalls abound. More and more schools around the world have begun to recognize this, their curricula evolving accordingly to equip the next generation with a level of financial acumen suited to these times.

data.title: Mayor shot dead in Narathiwat
data.description: The mayor of a tambon in Rueso district of  Narathiwat  was shot dead by a group of men armed with  war weapons  at his garment factory in the southern border province on Thursday.

data.title: CCPIT Green Tech Expo Highlights Lancang-Mekong Collaboration
data.description: The China Council for the Promotion of International Trade (CCPIT) announced the success of the "Lancang-Mekong Green Cooperation Exhibition" held recently at the Bangkok International Trade & Exhibition Centre (BITEC) in Bangkok, Thailand. The event attracted thousands of attendees and significantly raised awareness by showcasing collaborative achievements in the Lancang-Mekong region, reflecting a decade of prosperous cooperation and setting a new course for sustainable green development with cutting-edge technologies. It also demonstrated acceptance and support for the cooperation framework from both the public and private sectors of Thailand and China.

data.title: Watch industry failing to make models women want - survey
data.description: GENEVA — The watch industry is not producing and marketing enough models that women want to wear, a survey has found.

data.title: Indonesian volcano erupts eight more times
data.description: JAKARTA - Indonesia’s Mount Lewotobi Laki-laki erupted eight more times on Thursday, spewing a plume of volcanic ash up to 8,000 metres high, officials said, as the government scrambled to build homes for victims of a big eruption that killed nine.

data.title: Moo Deng ‘congratulates Trump’ on his election as US president
data.description: A statement was issued on behalf of Thailand's beloved baby pygmy hippopotamus Moo Deng congratulating Donald Trump on his victory in the US presidential election on Thursday.

data.title: Phumtham to send a clear message on sovereignty over Ko Kut
data.description: Defence Minister Phumtham Wechayachai will visit Koh Kut island in Trat province on Saturday to reiterate Thailand’s sovereignty over the island.

data.title: Pakistan’s air pollution sends nearly 1,000 to hospital
data.description: LAHORE — More than 900 people have been admitted to hospital in a single day in the Pakistani megacity of Lahore due to air pollution, the local government said.

data.title: Australia to ban social media for children under 16
data.description: Children in Australia under the age of 16 will be banned from  social media  as part of a push to protect young people’s mental health, Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has announced, with the companies involved required to enforce the new regulations or face potential fines.

data.title: Philippines evacuates thousands ahead of Typhoon Yinxing
data.description: The Philippines has evacuated thousands of people from coastal communities ahead of a major typhoon, officials said Thursday, just weeks after a tropical cyclone left at least 150 people dead.
